 Loading... 
 
 
 
 
 
 General databases for all subjects
                                 
 
 
 
 
 Web of Science (WOS) from Clarivate   Provides access to records from the top journals, conference proceedings, and books in the sciences, social sciences, and arts and humanities to find the high quality research most relevant to the area of interest. Using linked cited references, subject connections between articles that are established by the expert researchers can be explored. 
 
 
 Academic Search Complete   A scholarly, multidisciplinary database providing indexing and abstracts for more than 10,000 publications, including monographs, reports, conference proceedings, and others. Also includes full-text access to 5,500+ journals, including more than 4,600 peer-reviewed journals. Coverage is 1984-present. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Popular Databases 
 Loading... 
 The most frequently-used databases
             
 
 Academic Search Complete  This link opens in a new window   
 
 Popular 
 
 
 This opens a pop-up window to share the URL for this database 
 
 A scholarly, multidisciplinary database providing indexing and abstracts for more than 10,000 publications, including monographs, reports, conference proceedings, and others. Also includes full-text access to 5,500+ journals, including more than 4,600 peer-reviewed journals. Coverage is 1984-present. 
 
 
 
 PubMed@UCR  This link opens in a new window 
 
 Popular 
 
 
 This opens a pop-up window to share the URL for this database 
 
 PubMed includes MEDLINE and other biomedical databases. This premier database contains over 11 million journal citations and abstracts. 
 
 
 
 Web of Science (WOS) from Clarivate  This link opens in a new window 
 
 Popular 
 
 
 This opens a pop-up window to share the URL for this database 
 
 Provides access to records from the top journals, conference proceedings, and books in the sciences, social sciences, and arts and humanities to find the high quality research most relevant to the area of interest. Using linked cited references, subject connections between articles that are established by the expert researchers can be explored. 
 
 
 
 New / Trial Databases 
 Loading... 
 The following databases are newly acquired or being evaluated for a future subscription.
             
 
 Bibliography of Asian Studies  This link opens in a new window 
 
 Trial 
 
 
 This opens a pop-up window to share the URL for this database 
 
 Comprehensive Western-language bibliographical database for research on East, Southeast and South Asia. Published by the Association for Asian Studies, it covers all subjects with special focus on the humanities and social sciences. 
 
 
 
 British Association for the Advancement of Science Archives: Collections on the History of Science (1830s-1970s)  This link opens in a new window 
 
 New 
 
 
 This opens a pop-up window to share the URL for this database 
 
 The Archive of the British Association for the Advancement of Science (BAAS) and connected collections from UK universities covers astronomy, biology, technology, industrial design, chemistry, engineering, mathematics, agriculture, meteorology, physics, history of science and STEM, and government grants for scientific research. It contains administrative records, correspondence, illustrations, manuscripts, photographs, prototypes, clippings, personal papers, gray literature—all presented as fully searchable digital images that can be analyzed, downloaded, manipulated, and compared with content from other societies and universities in the Wiley Digital Archives platform. 
 
 
 
 Digital Theatre +  This link opens in a new window 
 
 New 
 
 
 This opens a pop-up window to share the URL for this database 
 
 Digital platform for performing arts featuring productions, theory & criticism, teaching resources, and videos of practitioners and their practice. 
 
 
 
 OverDrive  This link opens in a new window 
 
 New 
 
 
 This opens a pop-up window to share the URL for this database 
 
 OverDrive is an awesome new option for leisure reading, genre reading,  juvenile education and popular science titles.  Happy reading! 
 
 
 
 Yewno Discover  This link opens in a new window 
 
 New 
 
 
 This opens a pop-up window to share the URL for this database 
 
 Yewno is a discovery tool that provides a graphical display of the interrelationships between concepts.  Yewno uses computational semantics, graph theory, and machine learning to extract concepts from scholarly publications including journals, books, and theses, and displays search results in a graphical interface that displays the interrelationships between those concepts. Users can follow links in that display to find the underlying publications from which concepts and relationships are extracted, and the system integrates with library resource licenses allowing users to have direct access to the full text of underlying publications.
